welcome.title: Hi, I'm Cline
welcome.description1: I can do all kinds of tasks thanks to breakthroughs in
welcome.description3: agentic coding capabilities and access to tools that let me create & edit files, explore complex projects, use a browser, and execute terminal commands
welcome.description5: I can even use MCP to create new tools and extend my own capabilities.
welcome.signup_prompt: Sign up for an account to get started for free, or use an API key that provides access to models like Claude Sonnet.

alert_dialog.unsaved_changes_description: You have unsaved changes. Are you sure you want to discard them?

cli_banner.install_to_use_cline: Install to use Cline directly in your terminal and enable subagent capabilities. Cline can spawn
cli_banner.cline_can_spawn_commands: commands to handle focused tasks like exploring large codebases for information. This keeps your main context window clean by running these operations in separate subprocesses.
cli_banner.cline_cli_available: Cline CLI is available for macOS and Linux! Coming soon to other platforms.
cli_banner.subagents_available: Cline CLI & subagents are only available on macOS & Linux

info_banner.title: Cline in the Right Sidebar
info_banner.description: Keep your files visible when chatting with Cline. Drag the Cline icon to the right sidebar panel for a better experience.

cline_rules.rules_description: Rules allow you to provide Cline with system-level guidance. Think of them as a persistent way to include context and preferences for your projects or globally for every conversation.
cline_rules.workflows_description: Workflows allow you to define a series of steps to guide Cline through a repetitive set of tasks, such as deploying a service or submitting a PR. To invoke a workflow, type

new_rule_row.invalid_extension: Only .md, .txt, or no file extension allowed

checkmark_control.restore_files_description: Restores your project's files back to a snapshot taken at this point (use "Compare" to see what will be reverted)
checkmark_control.restore_task_only_description: Deletes messages after this point (does not affect workspace)
checkmark_control.restore_files_and_task_description: Restores your project's files and deletes all messages after this point

checkpoint_controls.restore_task_and_workspace_description: Restores the task and your project's files back to a snapshot taken at this point
checkpoint_controls.restore_task_only_description: Deletes messages after this point (does not affect workspace)
checkpoint_controls.restore_workspace_only_description: Restores your project's files to a snapshot taken at this point (task may become out of sync)

new_model_banner.title: Claude Haiku 4.5
new_model_banner.description: Anthropic's fastest model with frontier-level coding intelligence at a fraction of the cost.

telemetry_banner.title: Help Improve Cline
telemetry_banner.subtitle: (and access experimental features)
telemetry_banner.description: Cline collects error and usage data to help us fix bugs and improve the extension. No code, prompts, or personal information is ever sent.
telemetry_banner.settings_instruction: You can turn this setting off in

account.title: Account
account.organization_locked_tooltip: This cannot be changed while your organization has remote configuration enabled.

welcome.description: Sign up for an account to get access to the latest models, billing dashboard to view usage and credits, and more upcoming features.
welcome.agreement_prefix: By continuing, you agree to the

credit_limit_error.default_message: You have run out of credits.

hook_message.timeout_error: Took longer than 30 seconds. Check for infinite loops or add timeouts to network requests.
hook_message.validation_error: Hook returned invalid JSON. See error details below for more information.

browser_session.cline_wants_to_use_browser: Cline wants to use the browser:

chat.new_task_label: Cline wants to start a new task:
chat.condense_conversation_label: Cline wants to condense your conversation:
chat.report_bug_label: Cline wants to create a Github issue:

tool.edit_file: Cline wants to edit this file:
tool.delete_file: Cline wants to delete this file:
tool.create_file: Cline wants to create a new file:
tool.read_file: Cline wants to read this file:
tool.view_top_level_files: Cline wants to view the top level files in this directory:
tool.view_top_level_files_done: Cline viewed the top level files in this directory:
tool.view_files_recursively: Cline wants to recursively view all files in this directory:
tool.view_files_recursively_done: Cline recursively viewed all files in this directory:
tool.view_definitions: Cline wants to view source code definition names used in this directory:
tool.view_definitions_done: Cline viewed source code definition names used in this directory:
tool.search_files: Cline wants to search this directory for
tool.fetch_url: Cline wants to fetch content from this URL:
tool.fetch_url_done: Cline fetched content from this URL:

chat.outside_workspace: This file is outside of your workspace
chat.outside_workspace_directory: This is outside of your workspace
chat.textarea_placeholder: Type @ for context, / for slash commands & workflows, hold shift to drag in files/images
chat.mode_action_plan: gather information to architect a plan

errors.image_dimensions_exceeded: Image dimensions exceed maximum allowed size of 7500px
errors.failed_to_load_image: Failed to load image to check dimensions

command.requires_approval: The model has determined this command requires explicit approval.
command.terminal_manual_stop: This command is running in the VSCode terminal. You can manually stop it using Ctrl+C in the terminal, or switch to Background Execution mode in settings for cancellable commands.
command.use_subagent: Cline wants to use a subagent:

shell_integration.troubleshooting: Cline may have trouble viewing the command's output. Please update VSCode (CMD/CTRL + Shift + P → "Update") and make sure you're using a supported shell: zsh, bash, fish, or PowerShell (CMD/CTRL + Shift + P → "Terminal: Select Default Profile"). Still having trouble?

error_retry.auto_retry_failed_message: Auto-retry failed after {{maxAttempts}} attempts. Manual intervention required.

shell_integration_suggestion.title: Shell integration issues
shell_integration_suggestion.description: Since you're experiencing repeated shell integration issues, we recommend switching to Background Terminal mode for better reliability.

user_message.restore_all_title: Restore both the chat and workspace files to this checkpoint and send your edited message
user_message.restore_chat_title: Restore just the chat to this checkpoint and send your edited message

home_header.title: What can I do for you?
home_header.tooltip: I can develop software step-by-step by editing files, exploring projects, running commands, and using browsers. I can even extend my capabilities with MCP tools to assist beyond basic code completion.

nextjs_notetaking_app.title: Build a Next.js App
nextjs_notetaking_app.description: Create a beautiful notetaking app with Next.js and Tailwind

terminal_cli_tool.title: Craft a CLI Tool
terminal_cli_tool.description: Develop a powerful terminal CLI to automate a cool task

snake_game.title: Develop a Game
snake_game.description: Code a classic Snake game that runs in the browser.

api_options.provider_tooltip: Provider options are managed by your organization's remote configuration

common.api_key_help_text: This key is stored locally and only used to make API requests from this extension.
common.api_key_signup_text: You can get a{{article}} {{providerName}} API key by signing up here.

openai_compatible.note_content: Cline uses complex prompts and works best with Claude models. Less capable models may not work as expected.

bedrock.aws_profile_credentials_info: Using AWS Profile credentials from ~/.aws/credentials. Leave profile name empty to use the default profile. These credentials are only used locally to make API requests from this extension.
bedrock.aws_default_credentials_info: Authenticate by either providing the keys above or use the default AWS credential providers, i.e. ~/.aws/credentials or environment variables. These credentials are only used locally to make API requests from this extension.
bedrock.custom_model_info: Select "Custom" when using the Application Inference Profile in Bedrock. Enter the Application Inference Profile ARN in the Model ID field.

ollama.api_key_help_text: Optional API key for authenticated Ollama instances or cloud services. Leave empty for local installations.
ollama.unable_to_fetch_models: Unable to fetch models from Ollama server. Please ensure Ollama is running and accessible, or enter the model ID manually above.
ollama.request_timeout_description: Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for API responses before timing out.
ollama.note_content: Cline uses complex prompts and works best with Claude models. Less capable models may not work as expected.

provider_sorting_descriptions.default: Default behavior is to load balance requests across providers (like AWS, Google Vertex, Anthropic), prioritizing price while considering provider uptime
provider_sorting_descriptions.price: Sort providers by price, prioritizing the lowest cost provider
provider_sorting_descriptions.throughput: Sort providers by throughput, prioritizing the provider with the highest throughput (may increase cost)
provider_sorting_descriptions.latency: Sort providers by response time, prioritizing the provider with the lowest latency

featured_models.best_description: Recommended for agentic coding in Cline
featured_models.trending_description: Fast open-source model with improved performance in Cline
featured_models.free_description: Advanced model with 262K context for complex coding

model_info.preset_info: Using OpenRouter preset: {{presetName}}. Preset models reference your configured model preferences on OpenRouter. Model info and pricing will depend on your preset configuration.
model_info.model_fetch_info: The extension automatically fetches the latest list of models available on OpenRouter. If you're unsure which model to choose, Cline works best with anthropic/claude-sonnet-4.5. You can also try searching "free" for no-cost options currently available. OpenRouter presets can be used by entering @preset/your-preset-name

vertex.setup_instructions: To use Google Cloud Vertex AI, you need to
vertex.setup_step1: 1) create a Google Cloud account › enable the Vertex AI API › enable the desired Claude models,
vertex.setup_step2: 2) install the Google Cloud CLI › configure Application Default Credentials.

vscode_lm.no_models_available: The VS Code Language Model API allows you to run models provided by other VS Code extensions (including but not limited to GitHub Copilot). The easiest way to get started is to install the Copilot extension from the VS Marketplace and enabling Claude 4 Sonnet.
vscode_lm.experimental_note: Note: This is a very experimental integration and may not work as expected.

validation.api_key_required: You must provide a valid API key or choose a different provider.
validation.region_required: You must choose a region to use with AWS Bedrock.
validation.project_id_region_required: You must provide a valid Google Cloud Project ID and Region.
validation.base_url_api_key_model_required: You must provide a valid base URL, API key, and model ID.
validation.model_id_required: You must provide a valid model ID.
validation.model_selector_required: You must provide a valid model selector.
validation.sap_base_url_required: You must provide a valid Base URL key or choose a different provider.
validation.sap_client_id_required: You must provide a valid Client Id or choose a different provider.
validation.sap_client_secret_required: You must provide a valid Client Secret or choose a different provider.
validation.sap_token_url_required: You must provide a valid Auth URL or choose a different provider.
validation.dify_base_url_required: You must provide a valid Base URL or choose a different provider.
validation.hicap_api_key_required: You must provide a valid API key
validation.model_not_available: The model ID you provided is not available. Please choose a different model.

newtask.description: Create a new task with context from the current task

newrule.description: Create a new Cline rule based on your conversation

reportbug.description: Create a Github issue with Cline

deep-planning.description: Create a comprehensive implementation plan before coding

subagent.description: Invoke a Cline CLI subagent for focused research tasks

api_configuration.separate_models_checkbox: Use different models for Plan and Act modes
api_configuration.separate_models_description: Switching between Plan and Act mode will persist the API and model used in the previous mode. This may be helpful e.g. when using a strong reasoning model to architect a plan for a cheaper coding model to act on.

subagents.warning_message: Cline for CLI is required for subagents. Install it with:
subagents.description: Allows Cline to spawn subprocesses to handle focused tasks like exploring large codebases, keeping your main context clean.

features.enable_checkpoints_description: Enables extension to save checkpoints of workspace throughout the task. Uses git under the hood which may not work well with large workspaces.
features.enable_mcp_marketplace_description: Enables the MCP Marketplace tab for discovering and installing MCP servers.
features.mcp_display_mode_description: Controls how MCP responses are displayed: plain text, rich formatting with links/images, or markdown rendering.
features.collapse_mcp_responses_description: Sets the default display mode for MCP response panels
features.openai_reasoning_effort_description: Reasoning effort for the OpenAI family of models(applies to all OpenAI model providers)
features.enable_strict_plan_mode_description: Enforces strict tool use while in plan mode, preventing file edits.
features.enable_focus_chain_description: Enables enhanced task progress tracking and automatic focus chain list management throughout tasks.
features.focus_chain_reminder_interval_descriptio: Interval (in messages) to remind Cline about its focus chain checklist (1-100). Lower values provide more frequent reminders.
features.enable_dictation_description: Enables speech-to-text transcription using your Cline account. Uses the Aqua Voice's Avalon model, at $0.0065 credits per minute of audio processed. 5 minutes max per message.
features.enable_auto_compact_description: Enables advanced context management system which uses LLM based condensing for next-gen models.
features.enable_multi_root_workspace_description: Allows cline to work across multiple workspaces.
features.enable_hooks_not_supported: Hooks are not yet supported on Windows. This feature is currently available on macOS and Linux only.
features.enable_hooks_description: Allows execution of hooks from .clinerules/hooks/ directory.
features.enable_native_tool_call_description: Allows Cline to call tools through the native API.
features.enable_yolo_mode_description: EXPERIMENTAL & DANGEROUS: This mode disables safety checks and user confirmations. Cline will automatically approve all actions without asking. Use with extreme caution.

browser.disable_tool_usage_description: Prevent Cline from using browser actions (e.g. launch, click, type).
browser.viewport_size_description: Set the size of the browser viewport for screenshots and interactions.
browser.remote_browser_description_part1: Enable Cline to use your Chrome
browser.remote_browser_description_part3: You can specify a custom path below. Using a remote browser connection requires starting Chrome in debug mode
browser.remote_browser_description_part6: ) or using the button below. Enter the host address or leave it blank for automatic discovery.
browser.custom_browser_args_description: Space-separated arguments to pass to the browser executable.

terminal.default_terminal_profile_description: Select the default terminal Cline will use. 'Default' uses your VSCode global setting.
terminal.shell_integration_timeout_description: Set how long Cline waits for shell integration to activate before executing commands. Increase this value if you experience terminal connection timeouts.
terminal.enable_aggressive_terminal_reuse_descrip: When enabled, Cline will reuse existing terminal windows that aren't in the current working directory. Disable this if you experience issues with task lockout after a terminal command.
terminal.terminal_execution_mode_description: Choose whether Cline runs commands in the VS Code terminal or a background process.
terminal.terminal_output_limit_description: Maximum number of lines to include in terminal output when executing commands. When exceeded, lines will be removed from the middle, saving tokens.

general.enable_notifications_description: Receive system notifications when Cline requires approval to proceed or when a task is completed.
general.allow_error_usage_reporting_description_: Help improve Cline by sending usage data and error reports. No code, prompts, or personal information are ever sent. See our
general.remote_config_tooltip: This setting is managed by your organization's remote configuration
general.preferred_language_description: The language that Cline should use for communication.
general.ui_language_description: Select the language for the user interface.

about.title: Cline v{{version}}
about.description: An AI assistant that can use your CLI and Editor. Cline can handle complex software development tasks step-by-step with tools that let him create & edit files, explore large projects, use the browser, and execute terminal commands (after you grant permission).

marketplace.org_configured: Your organization has pre-configured the available MCP servers
marketplace.no_servers_found: No MCP servers found in the marketplace
marketplace.submit_description: Help others discover great MCP servers by submitting an issue to

add_remote.description: Add a remote MCP server by providing a name and its URL endpoint. Learn more
add_remote.connecting: Connecting to server... This may take a few seconds.

configure.description_part2: enables communication with locally running MCP servers that provide additional tools and resources to extend Cline's capabilities. You can use
configure.description_part3: or ask Cline to create new tools specific to your workflow (e.g., "add a tool that gets the latest npm docs").

chat_display.error_displaying_image: Something went wrong displaying this image
chat_display.error_displaying_link_preview: Something went wrong displaying this link preview

auto_approve.actions_description: Let Cline take these actions without asking for approval.
auto_approve.read_description: Allows Cline to read files within your workspace.
auto_approve.read_all_description: Allows Cline to read any file on your computer.
auto_approve.edit_description: Allows Cline to modify files within your workspace.
auto_approve.edit_all_description: Allows Cline to modify any file on your computer.
auto_approve.execute_safe_description: Allows Cline to execute safe terminal commands. If the model determines a command is potentially destructive, it will still require approval.
auto_approve.execute_all_description: Allows Cline to execute all terminal commands. Use at your own risk.
auto_approve.browser_description: Allows Cline to launch and interact with any website in a browser.
auto_approve.mcp_description: Allows Cline to use configured MCP servers which may modify filesystem or interact with APIs.
auto_approve.notifications_description: Receive system notifications when Cline requires approval to proceed or when a task is completed.

task_header.git_instructions: Git must be installed to use checkpoints.
task_header.multi_root_message: Checkpoints are not supported in multi-root workspaces.
task_header.click_context_window_bar: Click on the context window bar to set a new threshold.
task_header.context_window_exceeds: When the context window usage exceeds this threshold, the task will be automatically condensed.
task_header.new_steps_generated: New steps will be generated if you continue the task
task_header.click_to_edit_todo: Click to edit to-do list in file

chat_error_boundary.error_title: Something went wrong displaying this content

error_row.powershell_issue: It seems like you're having Windows PowerShell issues, please see this
error_row.diff_error: The model used search patterns that don't match anything in the file. Retrying...
error_row.clineignore_error: Cline tried to access {{file}} which is blocked by the {{clineignore}} file.

announcement.hooks_description: allow you to inject custom logic into Cline's workflow
announcement.bug_fixes_and_improvements: Bug fixes and improvements, including support for <think> tags (for better compatibility with open-source models), refinements to the GLM-4.6 system prompt, CLI auth & provider updates, and fixes for the OpenAI Compatible provider.
